definitions: To install or place something inside.
To submit or present something formally.
To spend time or effort on something.
To interrupt a conversation with a comment.
To make a request or claim.
To dock a ship or boat.
examples: They decided to put in a new kitchen.
She put in her application for the job.
He put in a lot of hours on that project.
She put in a quick remark during the meeting.
We need to put in a claim for the damaged goods.
The ship put in at the nearest port.
